Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Replace usage of namespace ids with OpenXmlNamespace" (#856) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
This change is fairly large and reworks how namespaces are handled internally. The main benefit of this change is it removes reliance on all inner workings on the namespace id. This was a hard coded value that was essentially a magic number for each namespace. This replaces that with a struct that handles the comparisons (`OpenXmlNamespace`) as well as a type that wraps that to identify a qualified name (`OpenXmlQualifiedName`). This change also makes it clear where a string is a name, a namespace, a prefix, etc.

This does not update the generated files to not use namespace ids. That is still in place, but is the last place where a namespace id is needed.

Closed issue "Could not load file or assembly 'DocumentFormat.OpenXml, Version=2.8.1.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=8fb06cb64d019a17'" (#814) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
I have 2 different .net (c#) projects on my VS2019: console app and class library project
I use DocumentFormat.OpenXml (2.11.3.0) and OpenXmlPowerTools (4.4.0.0) on both projects.

Both project were compilated successful. Conscole app works correct. But Class library project warn me the next error message:

**Exception thrown: 'System.IO.FileNotFoundException' in WordAssistant.dll
An exception of type 'System.IO.FileNotFoundException' occurred in WordAssistant.dll but was not handled in user code
Could not load file or assembly 'DocumentFormat.OpenXml, Version=2.8.1.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=8fb06cb64d019a17' or one of its dependencies. The system cannot find the file specified.**

CopyLocal =true and I see all libraries in output folder

app.config:
```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<configuration>
  <runtime>
    <assemblyBinding xmlns="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:asm.v1">
      <dependentAssembly>
        <assemblyIdentity name="Newtonsoft.Json" publicKeyToken="30ad4fe6b2a6aeed" culture="neutral" />
        <bindingRedirect oldVersion="0.0.0.0-12.0.0.0" newVersion="12.0.0.0" />
      </dependentAssembly>
      <dependentAssembly>
        <assemblyIdentity name="DocumentFormat.OpenXml" publicKeyToken="8fb06cb64d019a17" culture="neutral" />
        <bindingRedirect oldVersion="0.0.0.0-2.11.3.0" newVersion="2.11.3.0" />
      </dependentAssembly>
    </assemblyBinding>
  </runtime>
</configuration>
```

packages.config
```xml
<package id="DocumentFormat.OpenXml" version="2.11.3" targetFramework="net472" />
  <package id="Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word" version="15.0.4797.1003" targetFramework="net472" />
  <package id="Newtonsoft.Json" version="12.0.3" targetFramework="net472" />
  <package id="Open-Xml-PowerTools" version="4.4.0" targetFramework="net472" />
  <package id="System.IO.FileSystem.Primitives" version="4.3.0" targetFramework="net472" />
  <package id="System.IO.Packaging" version="5.0.0-rc.2.20475.5" targetFramework="net472" />
```
The same behaviour was explained [here](https://www.codeproject.com/Questions/503735/howplustoplusresolveplusthispluserror) at first Solution

I already updated both library from nuget. pls help

We have found bugs using [PVS-Studio](https://www.viva64.com/en/pvs-studio/) tool (static code analyzer for C, C++, C#, and Java).

Here is the report: [Analyzing the Code Quality of Microsoft's Open XML SDK](https://www.viva64.com/en/b/0777/).

Closed issue "Issue after upgrade from 2.11.3 to v2.12.0 - generated excel is not valid" (#829) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
**Description**

I'm using ClosedXML to generate some large Excel files. I just replaced OpenXML to 2.12 and the generated file is broken.
Reverting back to 2.11.3 is fixing it again. Opening the Excel shows this error message

"We found a problem with some content ... Do you want us to try to recover .."

**Information**

- .NET Target: 5.0
- DocumentFormat.OpenXml Version: 2.12.0

**Repro**

```csharp
// Please add a self-contained, minimum viable repro of the issue.
``` 

**Observed**

```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="true"?>
<recoveryLog xmlns="http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/spreadsheetml/2006/main">
<logFileName>error140160_01.xml</logFileName>
<summary>Errors were detected in file 'C:\file_broken.xlsx'</summary>
<removedRecords>
<removedRecord>Removed Records: Cell information from /xl/worksheets/sheet5.xml part</removedRecord>
</removedRecords>
<repairedRecords>
<repairedRecord>Repaired Records: Cell information from /xl/worksheets/sheet5.xml part</repairedRecord>
</repairedRecords>
</recoveryLog>
```

I compared the worksheet within Excel from a valid workbook generated with 2.11.3 with the repaired worksheet generated by 2.12.0 and could not find any difference so far ..

Comparing the sheet5.xml files might unveil this is related to `<x:v>xxx</x:v>` following formulars 

the broken version has additional properties similiar like:
`<x:f>Param.DateRange</x:f><x:v>23-Jun-2011  06:00 - 06:00 (0:00 h)</x:v></x:c>`
`<x:f>SUBTOTAL($D3,IOSTAT[busy '[%']])</x:f><x:v>0</x:v></x:c>`

while the valid version does not have them
`<x:f>Param.DateRange</x:f></x:c>`
`<x:f>SUBTOTAL($D3,IOSTAT[busy '[%']])</x:f></x:c>`


**Expected**

Please add your expected behavior here.
